intro: Dimacria foliolosa, commonly known as the leafy dimacria, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It produces small, yellow flowers arranged in a cluster, which bloom during the summer months. Dimacria foliolosa is typically found in grasslands and rocky areas, thriving in well-drained soils.
